pullRequest.body:
Refactor the the way the ids are extracted for the `dupNamespace` linter. We also extract this to a new file in anticipation of re-using that function in another linter.

The new version finds auto-generated names, such as `to_additive` names, but ignores "internal" names.  Like the previous linter, it also supports `export` and `alias`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [90d6a5a574](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17631/commits/90d6a5a5746a70469f51c49dff481b5fd161bd93)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +300.00% | `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.Lint` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.Lint | 1 | 4 | +3 (+300.00%) |
| Mathlib.Tactic | 2252 | 2255 | +3 (+0.13%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4870 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 199861 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ getAliasSyntax`
`+ getNamesFrom`
`- getIds`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I think the import of `import Lean.DeclarationRange` causes the unpleaseant "large-import" label

Technically, I think that the `large-import` is a consequence of adding `Common` to `Lint`.  Still, in this case it is not such a big deal: the actual imports of `Lint` are not increased, as the extra imported file is simply to add one extra function.

The linter is now catching some hygienic names that have duplicated namespace since their paths have duplicated names!  This is a great test for the linter and maybe suggests that the linter should ignore hygienic names in its checks.

You mentioned in the other PR that `export`s are not working as intended: I remember that there was something special about them in the older version of the linter, but looking at the code, I cannot find anything about it.  I'll have to investigate further what is going on with `export`.

I pushed a small change to the linter and a fix for the `to_additive` test.  I'm not sure if this version will ignore those "internal" declarations that were triggering the linter, but we will see.

There is still the issue of `export`, but `alias` seems to behave as expected now.

The way in which I would fix the `export` issue checking, would be by extracting the information of the new declaration added in the environment extension `Lean.aliasExtension`, that `export` seems to update.  I won't have time to get around to this for several hours, so if someone else wants to give it a shot, feel free to do so!  It would be similar to how the `declRange` extension is accessed, but then it might be a little trickier to figure out what has been added, since the information is not recorded with the position where it was added.
Oh, those internal declarations still show up: maybe we simply have to exclude them explicitly.
Locally, the current version passes the tests, including the `export` one.  Hopefully, this PR is now at the stage where we can focus on the details!  :smile:
Looks good to me now!
!bench
I'm now wondering if we want to move the extraction of the aliases to the separate file as well, since it might be independently useful.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/8327fd96-7810-4374-93c2-24bfe069483d) for commit 1aee3518e80af6261f4b3c7336886fb192a5f1e2.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/d491c6cb-51ad-4e0a-9fce-cab9a41a3c17) for commit fbfcaa9204266c66ee436fa797c6a1b30d049e72.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/da1adbff-d072-4571-b238-5997870b89d7/to/d491c6cb-51ad-4e0a-9fce-cab9a41a3c17) against commit 1fb2cbcfda77d978c076acdf586d370b83a7d4fb.

Thanks a lot for your work in this PR - it seems the new code is much more robust w.r.t. to certain tricky edge cases!
Looking at the PR, I only see a test (changed) for the to_additive change --- but not for any of the later gotchas, such as
- internal names
- aliasses in general (right?)
- exports
Can you add tests for that - so a future person (such as you or me in five years, when we'll have forgotten all the details here) will not "simplify" the implementation again? (I'm not sure if additional comments in the implementation are useful; up to you.)

Also, please mention these changes in the commit message: this PR is a lot more exciting now, and deserves to be noticed :-)

Dar Michael,

thank you for the review.  I think that `alias`es and `export`s were already tested before and are tested now: what other tests did you have in mind?

As for internal names, I ~~have not been able to generate one: if you want to give it a shot, feel free to do so!~~ added a test.
From my point of view this looks good to go now, and could be used in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17580, which was the starting point for this refactor, @grunweg.

I cannot find tests for `alias`es or `export`s (at least, not in `test/Lint.lean`. If you are really really sure they exist, that will suffice for me. Can you update the PR description - at least to mention `to_additive`, please? Then, I'll maintainer merge this. Thanks!

Thanks, I had overlooked the tests for `alias` and `export`. This looks good to me - thanks for all your careful effort in refining and polishing this linter!
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11396006667/job/31709123286)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11396006667/job/31709123554)

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Tactic/Linter/Lint): improve `dupNamespace` linter

source.title: feat: lint declarations which contain a double underscore
